Package arrayutils

Class Row

java.lang.Object
arrayutils.Row
public class Row
extends java.lang.Object
This class represents a single row in a test method table.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Row()
    Default constructor that calls a custom constructor passing the value of false.
    Row​(boolean isHeaderRow)
    Constructs a new row and stating whether it is a header row or not.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.lang.String buildInputList()

  • Constructor Details

    • Row

      public Row()
      Default constructor that calls a custom constructor passing the value of false.

    • Row

      public Row​(boolean isHeaderRow)
      Constructs a new row and stating whether it is a header row or not. In case it is a header row, the fields will be constructed using tags. Otherwise, it will construct the fields using tags.
      Parameters:
      isHeaderRow -

  • Method Details

      public java.lang.String getID()

      Returns:
      String containing the ID

    • getPass

      public java.lang.String getPass()
      Gets the Pass field surrounded by the appropriate tag accordingly with the isHeaderRow field
      Returns:
      String containing the Pass

    • setPass

      public void setPass​(boolean Pass)
      Sets the Pass field by concatenating the String value with the appropriate tag accordingly with the isHeaderRow field. This method is different of the setPass(String Pass). This method, setPass(boolean Pass), sets the value to "true" or "false". On the other hand, setPass(String Pass) sets whatever String value received in its argument.
      Parameters:
      Pass -

    • setPass

      public void setPass​(java.lang.String Pass)
      Sets the Pass field by concatenating the String value with the appropriate tag accordingly with the isHeaderRow field. See setPass(boolean Pass) for more information.
      Parameters:
      Pass -

    • isIsHeaderRow

      public boolean isIsHeaderRow()
      Gets the boolean value value indicating whether the instance is a headerRow or not.
      Returns:
      true or false.

    • buildInputList

      public java.lang.String buildInputList()
      Constructs a html unordered list by appending trailing and ending
        tags to the input.
      Returns:
      String containing the field formatted to build a HTML table.
